Which guide do you need to follow if your Verus Desktop wallet needs synchronization?
You need to follow the guide found at https://wiki.verus.io/#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md if your Verus Desktop wallet needs synchronization.

# How to import your Lite wallet address into your native Verus Desktop? Attention: Read it completely before using. ### Important General Information `verus command "<userinput>"` needs to be entered literally, with `<userinput>` replaced by your specific userdata. So if the text directs you to use for example `"<Public Address>"`, you replace that (including the `<` and `>`) with the address, so it looks similar to this: `"RYX6RYU3AAvwVCNyNM4cVyGUhSMUPvKs3r"`. This method is confirmed to work on Verus and all Komodo assetchains. ## Prerequisites In order to convert your seedphrase into a Private key (WIF), you need to have a running native wallet first, that is fully synchronized. The earliest wallet that supports these functions is **Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1**. If needed, use this guide to quickly synchronize your wallet: https://wiki.verus.io/#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md ## Converting Seed to WIF If you have a seed, you can retrieve your Private key (WIF) by having the Verus Desktop wallet convert it for you.
./raw_txt_input/how-to_convert-seed-to-wif.md
What command do you use to get your Private key (WIFin the Verus Desktop wallet?
You can use the command `verus command \"<userinput>\"` in the console to get your Private key (WIFin the Verus Desktop wallet. Remember to replace `<userinput>` with your specific userdata.

How can you retrieve your Private key (WIFfrom your seed in the Verus Desktop wallet?

You can retrieve your Private key (WIFfrom your seed in the Verus Desktop wallet by following these steps:
   - Have a running native wallet first, that is fully synchronized. The earliest wallet that supports these functions is **Verus Desktop v0.6.4-beta-1**.
   - If needed, synchronize your wallet using the guide found here: https://wiki.verus.io/#!how-to/how-to_bootstrap.md
   - Once the wallet is fully synchronized, you can use the command `verus command "<userinput>"` in the console. Replace `<userinput>` with your specific userdata.
